text: Albany is a city on the south coast of Western Australia. In 2006, there were 25,196 people living in Albany. Consists of Albany SSD (Central) and the State Suburbs of Milpara, Gledhow, McKail, Bayonet Head, Collingwood and Lower King in the 2006 census. The city centre is in between two hills, Mount Melville and Mount Clarence. ==Early history== Albany is built on King George Sound, named by Captain Vancouver in 1791. Major Edmund Lockyer started the first settlement here on 21 January 1827. The Governor of Western Australia, James Stirling, named the city Albany in 1832 after Prince Frederick, Duke of York and Albany, the second son of King George III. ==References== Category:Cities in Western Australia
title: Albany, Western Australia
